episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" is a Christmas special featuring facts about Icelandic Christmas folklore, ancient Greek contraception, the abundance of Christmas trees in Oregon, and the origins of the phrase "Merry Christmas" and Prosecco in English. The hosts explore various Christmas traditions and historical anecdotes, blending humor with intriguing trivia.

facts.fact: As well as getting a visit from Santa Claus at Christmas, Icelanders also get a visit from the spoon liquor, the door snapper, and the sausage swiper.
An ancient Greek form of contraception was a suppository made of frankincense, myrrh, and blister beetles.
Oregon has 12 times as many Christmas trees as humans.
The man who brought the phrase Merry Christmas to English was also the first Englishman to use the word Prosecco.
